Jobtitle: Administrative and Data Entry Officer
Company: HEALY DALOIA VISA CENTRE CO., LTD.
column8: About Us: Healy Daloia is an end-to-end Australian migration services provider with offices across Australia, São Paulo, and Bangkok. Our team are dedicated to guiding and supporting our clients in navigating the complexities of Australian migration law and procedure, and assisting them in achieving their Australian migration goals. Healy Daloia caters to migrants’ needs and requirements with a breadth of services, ranging from initial migration assessments and migration plan mapping, through to various Temporary, Provisional, and Permanent Resident visa applications. We also assist our clients in the eligibility verification and application processes for the Australian Skills Assessments for migration purposes, Australian Citizenship, and appeals to the Australian Administrative Appeals Tribunal and Ministerial Intervention requests for visa refusals and cancellations in Australia. https://www.healydaloia.com.au/ [link removed] Administrative and Data Entry Officer Role Purpose: Assisting the Healy Daloia Case Management team with their day-to-day work by following all company processes and procedures, and compiling and recording data in a timely and accurate manner. Education and Experience: University degree; higher education or certification in office administration or related field preferred. TOEIC score of at least 850+ At least 2 years of experience in an administrative or data entry role. Work Conditions: Standard Monday to Friday office hours with occasional overtime as needed. Office based (BTS Phrom Phong – EmQuartier). Salary: 20,000 – 25,000 baht per month depending on experience. Required Skills: Proficiency in data entry and data management. Excellent organisational, time management and multitasking abilities. Highly skilled in English communication, both written and verbal. Familiarity with spreadsheet management and document creation. Ability to handle confidential information with discretion. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy. Experience with client relationship management systems Demonstrated strong proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and Outlook. General Duties Displaying strong problem-solving skills, initiative, critical thinking and professionalism. Demonstrating a clear, polite and efficient communication style. Ensuring that internal communication is clear and regular – flagging any potential issues or delays ahead of time and keeping the team in the loop. Participating in team meetings and ‘having a voice’ within the wider team. Following up on action items from meetings and providing progress reports. Adhering to systems, policies, procedures and strong productivity standards. Ensuring all deadlines are met and time is managed effectively. Strictly adhering to internal and external processes, including ensuring that all data sets, file notes and spreadsheets are complete, up-to-date and correct. Maintaining quality service by enforcing quality and customer service standards, analysing and resolving quality and customer service problems, and recommending system improvements where appropriate. Effectively troubleshooting any issues and escalating these to your manager when appropriate. Displaying competency across all of Healy Daloia’s systems and software including Migration Manager and the Microsoft Office Suite. Contributing to team effort by helping out when required. Contributing to team morale through ensuring a safe, ethical and legal work environment. Operational Duties Managing client consultation requests and bookings. Monitoring payments for consultations, services and commissions. Corresponding with prospective and current clients via email by providing consultation-booking instructions, answering general enquiries, sending through deposit requests, requesting personal information, issuing payment reminders and general follow-ups etc. Creating and maintaining meticulous file notes for prospective and current clients in the ‘Migration Manager’ platform. Verifying client details and information in questionnaires and forms, and in Healy Daloia’s systems and software. Deciphering and inputting relevant data into Excel spreadsheets, ensuring that the spreadsheets are closely monitored and maintaining the data so that it remains current. Managing email communication and requests from other team members, and ensuring timely responses and actions. Preparing and sending contract agreements to prospective and current clients. Preparing, updating, and dispatching agreements and other client-related documents. Compiling, verifying and organising client files, information and other general files. Organising national police clearances in Australia and foreign countries. Engaging with clients eligible for new contracts or services, providing detailed estimates and information as guided by the registered migration agent. Requesting quotes from third-party providers. Training and following-up other staff and new team members as required.

Jobtitle: EHS Data Analyst & DCC
column8: Key Responsibilities: Data Analysis: Collect, validate, and analyze EHS data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualization tools to communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics. Collaborate with EHS teams to interpret data and provide insights for strategic decision-making. Environmental, Health, and Safety Compliance: Stay informed about relevant EHS regulations and standards to ensure data accuracy and compliance. Assist in the preparation of reports for regulatory agencies and internal stakeholders. Conduct audits to verify compliance with EHS policies and procedures. Document Control: Establish and maintain a document control system for EHS-related documents, ensuring version control and accessibility. Collaborate with various departments to collect, review, and approve documents for accuracy and compliance. Conduct periodic reviews to ensure document control processes are effective and efficient. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with EHS, Quality, and Operations teams to ensure accurate and timely reporting of EHS data. Collaborate with IT and other relevant departments to optimize data collection and management systems. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains within EHS data management and document control. Participate in the development and implementation of strategies to enhance overall EHS performance. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Environmental Science, Occupational Health and Safety, Data Analytics, or related field. Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in an EHS context. Jobtitle: Legal Officer
column8: Overall values: Passionate in Aura. Strong passion in bringing a high-quality medical service to everyone at a reasonable price. Always stay in a fast-paced, revenue-driven work environment. Always analyze and optimize on-the-go. We are bringing the aesthetic industry towards a new break through, there will be many obstacles. Persevere through all of them. We value high-growth employees and reward them handsomely. Evaluate and give constructive feedback your team to support high-growth career path. Excellent presentation skill with strong logical thinking. Excellent management skill. Always plan ahead. Always have backup plan. Strong can-do attitude. Always strive only for the best. Always go beyond expectation. Always set an almost impossible goal. Never settle for an easy one. Purpose of the position: To ensure legal compliance and provide expert guidance on legal matters related to the business's operations. Key Responsibilities: Legal Compliance: Monitor and assess the clinic's compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and licensing requirements. Develop and implement internal policies and procedures to ensure compliance with legal standards. Contract Drafting and Review: Prepare, review, and negotiate contracts, agreements, and legal documents. This includes lease agreements, vendor contracts, employment contracts, and client consent forms. Ensure legal protection and compliance while safe guarding the clinic's interests. Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on relevant laws, regulations, and guidelines governing the aesthetic industry in Thailand. Monitor changes in legislation and provide timely advice to management on potential impacts and necessary adjustments to business operations. Licensing and Permitting: Facilitate the acquisition and renewal of licenses, permits, and certifications required for the clinic's operations. Coordinate with relevant authorities and government agencies to ensure all necessary documents are obtained and maintained. Legal Advice and Risk Management: Provide legal advice and guidance to management and staff on various legal matters, including but not limited to healthcare regulations, data privacy, intellectual property, and employment law. Identify potential legal risks and propose strategies to mitigate them. Dispute Resolution: Assist in resolving legal disputes, including patient complaints, contract disputes, and employment-related issues. Collaborate with external legal counsel when necessary and represent the clinic's interests during legal proceedings. Key Qualifications & Skills: Bachelor's Degree in Law or higher. Barrister-at-law and/or lawyer license would be an advantage. At least 2 - 3years of experience ni legal work or corporate. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Strong contract drafting and negotiation skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex legal concepts in simple terms.
